data.title: Can't get over the mind-blowing climax of Maharaja? 9 other films you should watch asap
data.meta_description: If you cannot get over the mind-blowing climax of Vijay Sethupathi starrer Maharaja, here are other South Indian as well as Bollywood films you should watch for unforgettable climax sequences.
data.text:
Vijay Sethupathi's 50th movie Maharaja has turned out to be a game-changer. Everyone who has watched the movie is raving about the film - from Anurag Kashyap's acting to Vijay Sethupathi's stellar performance, from the mind-blowing climax to the heavy emotional wallop. In case you missed watching the Nithilan Saminathan directorial in theatres, the emotional revenge drama is streaming on Netflix and is already dominating the charts on the platform. In case you also cannot get over the jaw-dropping climax of the movie, here are nine movies you should watch asap.

Can't get over Maharaja's climax? Watch these 9 films asap

1. Super Deluxe

The 2019 movie starring Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil, Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Ramya Krishnan among others is about three interconnected plots that merge in the end. The climax sequence will definitely blow your mind.

2. Soodhu Kavvum

The black comedy crime comedy movie starring Vijay Sethupathi, Ashok Selvan and Bobby Simha, which is hailed as one of the best films of recent times. The plot of the movie revolves around a politician's son who gets kidnapped after planning his own kidnapping to extract money from his father. Problems arise when an insane cop is brought to handle the case.

3. Kurangu Bommai

The 2017 Tamil film starring Vidharth, Bharathiraja and Delna Davis is a story of a loyal worker and a boss who exploits him for wrong doings that lands him in trouble. It is said that the film had one of the best climaxes.

4. Iratta

One of the best Malayalam movies of 2023, Iratta is an emotional suspense filled thriller which stars Joju George in dual roles along with Anjali, Arya Arya Salim and Srikant Murali. The story revolves around twins, one of whom dies on duty. The investigation into the case leads to a lot of secrets including the real reason for his death.

Also Read: 5 reasons why Vijay Sethupathi & Anurag Kashyap's Maharaja on Netflix is blowing people's minds

5. Ratsasan

The movie starring Vishnu Vishal and Amala Paul is about a police officer who is looking for a mysterious killer who targets school girls and murders them brutally. The film was later remade in Hindi as Cuttputlli.

6. Andhadhun

This movie starring Ayushmann Khurrana and Radhika Apte will leave you scratching your head throughout and perhaps even after you watch the ending. Everyone has their own theories on how this murder mystery ends.

Also Read: From Maharaja to Mandakini, South OTT releases to watch this week on Prime Video, Netflix, Hotstar and other platforms

7. Drishyam

The film franchise which is set for a Hollywood remake is hailed as one of the best works in Indian cinema. Starring Mohanlal in the Malayalam version and Ajay Devgn in the Hindi film, the climax of the murder mystery is mind-blowing.

8. Ugly

Directed by Anurag Kashyap, the Indian thriller film starring Rahul Bhat, Ronit Roy, Girish Kulkarni and Siddhanth Kapoor among other investigates the case of a missing girl and sheds light on human greed. The ending is unpredictable.

Also Read: Maharaja OTT release: Here's when and where to watch Vijay Sethupathi and Anurag Kashyap's movie

9. Kahaani

One of the best films of Vidya Balan, Kahaani has so many twists and turns that you will never be able to unravel the climax of the movie. The story of film revolves around a woman who is looking for the traces of her husband who has gone missing. The film has one of the best climaxes ever.
